clinical_question: Should patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD receive T2T strategies or usual care?
population: Patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD
outcome: Remission (follow up: range 6 months to 1.5 years; assessed with: DAS 44 <1.4 and DAS28 ESR <2.6)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment and lack of blinding.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

population: Patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD
outcome: Radiographic progression (follow up: range 1 years to 1.5 years; assessed with: modified Sharp score)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment, lack of blinding, and attrition bias.

Inconsistency.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. I2= 78%.

clinical_question: Should patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD receive T2T strategies or usual care?
population: Patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD
outcome: Disability (follow up: range 1.5 years to 2 years; assessed with: HAQ-DI)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment, lack of blinding, and attrition bias.

Inconsistency.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. I2= 71%.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD receive T2T strategies or usual care?
population: Patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD
outcome: Withdrawal due to lack of efficacy (follow up: range 1.5 years to 2 years)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment, lack of blinding, and attrition bias.

Inconsistency.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. I2= 75%.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD receive T2T strategies or usual care?
population: Patients with RA who have not been previously treated with boDMARD and tsDAMRD
outcome: Withdrawal due to adverse events (follow up: range 6 months to 1.5 years)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious risk of bias. Two studies consisting of 97% of the weight have high risk of bias due to lack of allocation concealment, lack of blinding of outcome assessors, and reporting incomplete outcome data.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
